children: Characteristic features of nail psoriasis include distal onycholysis (separation of the nail plate from the underlying nail bed) [
] and splinter hemorrhages, which represent the Auspitz sign (punctuate bleeding) in the nail bed. In addition, some patients may display the “oil-stain” sign (
), which is characterized by a localized tan to brown discoloration of the nail. In more severe forms of psoriatic involvement, there can be thickening and crumbling of the nails.
